description: Students explore the intersections of music and community engagement through case studies on
topics such as music and healthcare, education, Indigenous cultural agency, development, and
immigration. Coursework includes a significant project developing a partnership between students
and local community organizations. Students build skills in reading, writing, oral communication,
project management, and community relations. Assignments include reading, listening, written
reflections, research on issues relevant to community partners, and on- and off-campus engagement
with community partners. Offered alternate years in spring semester. Prerequisite: MUSIC 141
Introduction to Musicology and MUSIC 237 Local and Global Musicking.
